decision_conditions: The development hereby approved including modifications to change the internal layout of the existing building as shown on the approved drawings listed in Condition 2 shall be completed within three (3) years from the date of this permission otherwise the planning permission will lapse.

Reason: To secure appropriate living conditions for future occupiers, in accordance with Policy D6 of the London Plan (2021) and Policy 3.5 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing numbers and supporting document(s):
C40-A (Proposed Alterations to Ground and Second Floor);
C10 - F (Proposed Ground, Site Layout and GIA's);
C11 - D (Proposed First Floor and Roof Plan);
C20 - B (Proposed Elevations 1);
C21 - B (Proposed Elevations 2);
C23 - B (Proposed Section A-A);
C30 - C (Axonometric Facing North East);
C31 - D (Axonometric Facing South West);
C32 - A (Proposed Site Model looking North East)
C33 - A (Proposed Site Model Looking North West);
C34 - A (Proposed Exploded Axonometric);
1027-112_2D (A1) (2D Topographical Survey);
Sustainability Statement, dated 25 October 2023;
Fire Statement, dated 25 October 2023;
Design and Access Statement, 25 January 2023.
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interest of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building, unless otherwise stated in the submitted application form or approved drawings.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).

| Notwithstanding the approved drawings and supporting documents, details of hard and soft landscaping, boundary treatments, cycle storage and refuse storage shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, prior to commencement of the development. Any trees or plants which within 5 years of planting, die, are removed or become seriously damaged or diseased shall be replaced with others of the same size and species and in the same positions within the next planting season. The development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details and retained as such thereafter.

Reason: To ensure appropriate hard and soft landscaping, boundary treatments, cycle storage and refuse storage in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area, to ensure appropriately landscaped amenity space, in accordance with Policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021), Policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and Policy DAA of Ealing's draft Local Plan (Regulation 19). | No part of the flat roof(s) of the hereby approved development shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof terrace/garden or similar amenity area.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties and future occupiers of the development, in accordance with Policies 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and Policy DAA of Ealing's draft new Local Plan (Regulation 19).

| The hereby approved first and second floor windows on the south and north elevations of the building serving four (4) self-contained residential flats shall be obscure-glazed and non-opening unless the parts of the window which can be opened are more than 1.7 metres above the floor of the room in which the window is installed.

Reason: To ensure that the proposed development does not prejudice the amenities of adjoining occupiers, in accordance with Policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and Policy DAA of Ealing's draft new Local Plan (Regulation 19). | During the implementation of the development hereby approved control measures shall ensure that the following standards and requirements are implemented and adhered to:
- noise and vibration (according to Approved CoP BS 5228-1 and -2:2009+A1:2014),
- dust (according to Supplementary Planning Guidance by the GLA (2014) for The Control of Dust and Emissions during Construction and Demolition),
- lighting ('Guidance Note 01/20 For The Reduction Of Obtrusive Light' by the Institution of Lighting Professionals),
- hours of work and all associated activities audible beyond the site boundary restricted to 0800-1800hrs Mondays to Fridays, 0800 -1300 Saturdays (no work on public holidays),
- neighbour liaison, notifications to interested parties and considerate complaints procedure,
- public display of contact details including accessible phone numbers for persons responsible for the work for the duration of the works in case of emergencies, enquiries or complaints.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise, vibration, dust, lighting or other emissions from the site, in accordance with Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), Policy D14 of the London Plan 2021, the Greater London Authority Best Practice Guidance 'The Control of Dust and Emissions from Construction and Demolition (2006), and BS 5228-1:2009 - Code of practice for noise & vibration control on construction & open sites-Part 1: Noise density. | The sound insulation of the building envelope including glazing specifications shall  be based on environmental noise levels occurring during most of the year, ie. measured during school and work weekdays, and in accordance with internal noise limits specified in BS8233:2014. If compliance requires the windows to be closed, then acoustically attenuated mechanical ventilation and cooling shall be installed (with air intake from the cleanest aspect of the building and low self-noise). Internal room- and external amenity noise levels shall not exceed noise limits specified in BS8233:2014. The submitted details shall include both the existing and proposed buildings. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the site, in accordance with Policies D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2021) and Policies 3.5 and 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).

| The individual and combined external sound level emitted from plant, machinery or equipment at the development site shall be lower than the lowest existing background sound level by at least 10dBA, as measured at/ calculated to the nearest and most affected noise sensitive premises at the development site and at surrounding premises. The assessment shall be made in accordance with BS4142:2014 +A1 2019, with all machinery operating together at maximum capacity.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise from mechanical installations/ equipment, in accordance with Policies D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2021) and Policies 3.5 and 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).

| Prior to use, machinery, plant and equipment/ extraction/ ventilation system and ducting at the development shall be mounted with proprietary anti-vibration isolators and fan motors shall be vibration isolated from the casing and adequately silenced and maintained as such.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by vibration noise from mechanical installations/ equipment, in accordance with Policies D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2021) and Policies 3.5 and 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).

| Prior to commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to the Council  for approval in writing, of an enhanced sound insulation value of at least 5dB above the maximum Building Regulations value, for the floor/ceiling/wall structures separating different types of rooms/uses in adjoining dwellings/areas, namely, bedrooms above/below/adjoining kitchen/ living/ dining/ bathroom of separate dwellings and adjoining the communal staircase. The submitted details shall include both the existing and proposed buildings. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with Policies D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2021) and Policies 3.5 and 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).
description: Construction of a two storey building containing two (2) self-contained residential units; conversion of existing dwelling into four (4) self-contained residential flats; single storey side/rear (wrap around) extension; first floor rear extension; first floor side extension; conversion of loft space into habitable room and associated roof extensions and external alterations; provision of private amenity space, refuse and cycle storage (part retrospective)
